challengeName: CSFV Frontend Module CentOS Deployment Guide
detailedRequirements:
TCO Points : The winner will get rewarded a 30 pts via Jira Races Competition Ticket.

 

Asking questions in the forums are improtant for the success of this challenge, as copilot has familiarity with the deployment and will help you with any details needed.

 

Project Overview

This project, the CSFV Community Gaming website project will provide the web site infrastructure and integration of the games. This will be a web site that is available on the Internet, and also will be delivered in a form where the server and the games can be installed and used behind a firewall.

The goal of this challenge is to update the csfv_frontend_module readme file to provide clear information about deployment of the application in CentOS server.

Competition Task Overview

The readme file should have the following sections :

  • Overview : CSFV Overview - you can take the project overview above.
  • Dependencies : It should list both CSFV depenedencies and 3rd party dependencies with links to these modules.
  • Configuration : It should mention in details the configuration in config/settting-dev.js
  • Social Network Apps Setup : this should detail how to setup twitter, facebook and google in order to enable Register/Login and to connect existing profile with these accounts.
  • External dependencies setup : Things to explain are how to setup git, mongo, mysql, graphicMagik, wkhtmltopdf (this is needed by wiki pdf generation), mailchimp, any any other libraries or 3rd party tool that need guide for setup.
  • CSFV Dependencies Setup : Some pages require some data setup in CMS, Forums, Chat .. etc.
  • Local Deployment : Explains how in details the steps needed to setup, deploy and run the application locally.
  • Generating Test Data : Explains how to generate test data
  • Testing : Explains how to test the setup.
  • For each section, it should have "CentOS" head so user can understand the setup related to CentOS. We are launching a followup F2F challenges to add specific instructions for Ubuntu, Windows, and Mac.
  • Any other section you add that improve the deployment so it is easier for the member, we will pay you additional $50 for it. The enhancment will be judged by Copilot.

Testing

Copilot will review the submission, a test will run against all pages of the mainsite to verify that everything needed to setup was done.

GitHub Code

The code are placed in private github repository, request access if you don't have http://github.com/topcoderinc/csfv_frontend_module

Resource

  • This an old wiki for how to setup the application on CentOS - it might help http://apps.topcoder.com/wiki/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=102858815
  • You must use Github Flavored Markup to structure the README file https://help.github.com/articles/github-flavored-markdown
